summary: This is a US Marshals Service prisoner schedule report for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 31, 2019. It lists prisoners scheduled for court appearances, meetings, or other proceedings, including Jeffrey Epstein, who is noted for a status hearing and has 'Suicidal Tendencies' listed under mental concerns.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Listed as a prisoner at MCC New York scheduled for a status hearing before Judge Berman; his offense is listed as a sex offense and he has mental concerns noted as 'Suicidal Tendencies'.

events.title: Epstein's Scheduled Status Hearing
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is scheduled for a status hearing at court before Judge Berman while detained at MCC New York.

events.title: Multiple Prisoner Court Appearances
events.description: Numerous prisoners at MCC New York are scheduled for various court proceedings including status hearings, sentencings, change of pleas, and meetings with prosecutors.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
500 Pearl St, Manhattan, NY (likely the Daniel Patrick Moynihan United States Courthouse)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was a prisoner at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York as of July 31, 2019.
Epstein's prisoner record lists 'Mental Concerns: Suicidal Tendencies' and his offense as a sex offense.
Epstein was scheduled for a status hearing before Judge Berman on July 31, 2019.
The document is a routine US Marshals prisoner schedule, showing Epstein was among many detainees with scheduled court activities that day.
The document provides a snapshot of Epstein's institutional status and noted vulnerabilities shortly before his death in August 2019.
